meanings.definition: A person who is ardently devoted to a particular person, activity, or cause.
meanings.sent1: The devotees of the famous singer waited outside the concert hall for hours.
meanings.sent2: The devotees of the local football team cheered loudly at every game.
meanings.sent3: The devotees of chocolate were thrilled to discover a new ice cream flavor.
meanings.sent4: Her garden was a sanctuary for devotees of peace and tranquility.
meanings.sent5: The devotees of yoga found inner peace through their daily practice.

meanings.definition: Followers or supporters of a particular person, activity, or cause.
meanings.sent1: The devotees of the environmental movement organized a beach cleanup.
meanings.sent2: The devotees of the author's work eagerly awaited the release of his new book.
meanings.sent3: The devotees of the soccer team painted their faces in team colors for the match.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, she had a legion of devotees who admired her designs.
meanings.sent5: The devotees of the charity raised funds through a bake sale for a good cause.
